Create the *smallest* test you can that demonstrates the problem.  Remove
everything from the test that is superfluous to making the problem occur.
Remove everything from the code under test that is superfluous to making the
problem occur.

When you have the smallest possible code that demonstrates the problem, the
cause and its solution will probably be easy to find.

If not, you can then post the code to this mailing list and people will have
some chance of helping you.

--Nat

On 29/10/2007, jls_nayak1983 <jls_nayak1983@...> wrote:
>
>
> Hi,
>
> I am working on Junit testing for swing application. I am using
> Abbot framework for gui testing. I have written a test class with some
> test cases. I created suite of tests by overriding the suite method.
>
> As I start the testing, the first test case is run and after that
> the testing gets suddently stopped. It neither reports for failure or
> successful of testing.
>
> How can I resolve the problem ?
>
> Thanks
>
>  
>
